subject: Business
title: Cognitive Dissonance After Purchase
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cognitive Dissonance After Purchase.

hook.text: You buy an expensive car. The next day, you read every positive review to convince yourself you chose right.

buildup.text: Cognitive dissonance is the discomfort of holding conflicting beliefs â€” like 'I'm smart' and 'I just overspent.'

discovery.text: Post-purchase, buyers actively seek information confirming their choice and avoid anything that contradicts it.

twist.text: Smart brands send 'congratulations' emails after purchase. They reduce dissonance and prevent returns.

climax.text: Apple unboxing is a ritual designed to reinforce the purchase. Every detail says: 'You made the right choice.'

punchline.text: The sale isn't over at checkout. It's over when regret disappears.

quiz.question: Why do buyers seek positive reviews after purchasing?
options: To reduce cognitive dissonance and confirm they made the right choice
They forgot to read reviews before buying
Positive reviews offer new product features
